text: I kept researching with this topic, and I still have issues... I think I will need to use a MapView besides a mapFragment.
<@U1GQD5RUN>: we can't help you without source code.

Thanks <@U061HDV96>, I have an App that has a Google Map in it. So I need to create a custom Map Event. This is when I pinch the screen to zoomIn and zoomOut the map, I want that the maps disabled the scroll while im zooming. iOS has in its Google SDK that feature called allowScrollGesturesDuringRotateOrZoom. But sadly in Android SDK there no that :disappointed:

So I found a great answer in StackOverflow: <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/31958074/android-googlemaps-v2-disable-scroll-on-pan-or-zoom>

The thing is that I have a MainActivity with the fragment map. But when I was trying to achieve the custom class in the link. I was having that issue, my screen was turning black and with tat Logs.

Im trying right now, doing this with a MapView... deleting the map fragment XML. And I can see that now is working...but Im trying to relocate all de Map Callbacks. If I still having issues, I will upload this issue with source code in stackoverflow. or right here to ask for help.

attachments.title: Android googlemaps V2 - Disable scroll on pan or zoom
attachments.text: I would like to disable scroll on Android googlemaps when the user is zooming. In IOS google maps, its kind of easy, just set a parameter: self.settings.allowScrollGesturesDuringRotateOrZoom = NO;
attachments.fallback: Android googlemaps V2 - Disable scroll on pan or zoom

text: <@U1J963TAQ|bendikv> has joined the channel
<@U1J96RE0K|sylk> has joined the channel
Hi
I am going through the process of learning how to program right now through the Intro to Java class on Udacity

I am actually super pissed at the amount of math related exercices we have to do through the course, I hate math though I find programming pretty fun. Do you guys really do that much math when you work?
Let me be more precise when I say doing math, I mean solving complex math problems hahaha
<@U06QL7UHK>: Unless you are doing game dev or graphics intensive dev simple maths with be all you need when programming in android.
You’re making me feel much better all of a sudden, thanks <@U1CV5DAMT>
I was starting to think maybe programming wasn’t for me hahaha
<@U06QL7UHK>: Programming is more logic than math IMO
The math aspects tend to be exaggerated

To me it feels more like learning an actual human language. I mean, I’m a business person who lived in German speaking countries, can speak French and Brazilian Portuguese, and I feel like when I’m learning how to program I’m doing the same
Except the exercices they give in the classes are really lame, annoying and very math savy, which I HATE
Make me want to run away as fast as possible.
I don’t have anything against math, but I think it’s ok to accept that not everybody likes it you know.
Well it is called a *compute* r
emphasis on the compute because that’s what it was invented for :smile:
It’s a glorified calculator
